result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis M. Weix was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Prostitution-Nonmmarital Sexual Intercourse, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.30(1m)(a).
  • Prostitution-Nonmmarital Sexual Intercourse, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.30(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation on counts 1&2 to run concurrent to each other.

miscConds.notes:
Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request
Defendant is not to have any internet access through any type of device without prior approval of the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
